main event: On 3 Dec 59 in Greenville, Miss., a UFO was observed by an F-100 pilot making a runway compass check. The object was described as tail-like and traveling faster than an aircraft. The possibility of a daylight meteor was considered, but the time duration of the sighting was lengthy.
interesting points: The UFO sighting occurred during an F-100 runway compass check, drawing the attention of the pilot to the object.
The object was described as tail-like and traveling faster than an aircraft.
The possibility of a daylight meteor was considered, but the duration of the sighting was lengthy, creating uncertainty.
The reliability of the observer, TSGT Johnny E. Reddick, was highlighted, stating he is completely reliable and not under the influence of alcohol or impaired vision.
The UFO was observed directly overhead, very high, and then seen moving to the west at an angle, with no other natural phenomena reported in the area.
sighted object: tail-like UFO traveling faster than an aircraft
witnesses: TSGT Johnny E. Reddick, a reliable and experienced observer
